blackengine.rendering.pipeline.shaderPrograms.shaders

Class Shader

  • java.lang.Object
    • blackengine.rendering.pipeline.shaderPrograms.shaders.Shader
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FragmentShader, VertexShader

    public abstract class Shader
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Shader(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String shaderSource)
      Default constructor for creating a new instance of Shader.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void attachTo(int shaderProgramId)
      Attaches this shader to the shader program referenced by the provided ID.
      protected abstract int create(java.lang.String shaderSource)
      An implementation of this member should compile the shader, load it to the graphics card and return its reference ID.
      void destroy()
      Destroys this shader on the graphics card by detaching it from the shader program (if there was any), and deleting the shader.
      void detach()
      Detaches this shader from the shader program it was attached to, if any.
      java.util.stream.Stream<java.lang.String> getAttributeNames()
      Getter for the attribute names found in this shader.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Getter for the name of this shader.
      java.util.stream.Stream<java.lang.String> getUniformNames()
      Getter for the uniform names found in this shader, including the separated uniform array element names.
      boolean isAttached()
      Getter for whether this shader is attached to a shader program or not.
      boolean isDestroyed()
      Getter for whether this shader was destroyed.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Shader

        public Shader(java.lang.String name,
              java.lang.String shaderSource)
        Default constructor for creating a new instance of Shader.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the shader.
        shaderSource - The source of the shader.

    • Method Detail

      • getUniformNames

        public java.util.stream.Stream<java.lang.String> getUniformNames()
        Getter for the uniform names found in this shader, including the separated uniform array element names.
        Returns:
        An instance of Stream containing the uniform variable names and uniform array element names.

      • getAttributeNames

        public java.util.stream.Stream<java.lang.String> getAttributeNames()
        Getter for the attribute names found in this shader.
        Returns:
        An instance of Stream containing the attribute names.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Getter for the name of this shader.
        Returns:
        An instance of String representing the name of this shader.

      • isAttached

        public boolean isAttached()
        Getter for whether this shader is attached to a shader program or not.
        Returns:
        True if this shader is attached to a valid shader program, false otherwise.

      • isDestroyed

        public boolean isDestroyed()
        Getter for whether this shader was destroyed.
        Returns:
        True if this shader was destroyed, false otherwise.

      • attachTo

        public void attachTo(int shaderProgramId)
        Attaches this shader to the shader program referenced by the provided ID.
        Parameters:
        shaderProgramId - The ID of the shader program this shader should be attached to.

      • detach

        public void detach()
        Detaches this shader from the shader program it was attached to, if any.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Destroys this shader on the graphics card by detaching it from the shader program (if there was any), and deleting the shader. After destroying this shader, it's reference ID is invalid, and this instance should not be reused.

      • create

        protected abstract int create(java.lang.String shaderSource)
        An implementation of this member should compile the shader, load it to the graphics card and return its reference ID.
        Parameters:
        shaderSource - The source of the shader to compile and load.
        Returns:
        The shader reference ID.
